```{r Import and Cleaning, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
Study_Data <- read.csv("Pilot Study DATA.csv")

Qualtrics_DF <-  #Selecting relevant columns from csv
  Study_Data %>% select(ResponseId, SLIDS1_1, SLIDS1_2, SLIDS1_3, TRUSTS1, SLIDS2_1, SLIDS2_2, SLIDS2_3,
                        TRUSTS2, SLIDS3_1, SLIDS3_2, SLIDS3_3, TRUSTS3, age, gen, Education, ProlificID, 
                        S1_Condition, S2_Condition, S3_Condition)


Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF[-c(1,2),] #delete 1st and second row meta data

                              
Qualtrics_DF <-  #Renaming columns for readability
  Qualtrics_DF %>% rename(ID = ResponseId, Age = age, Gender = gen, Prolific_ID = ProlificID,
                              Risk_S1 = SLIDS1_1, Performance_S1 = SLIDS1_2, 
                              Integrity_S1 = SLIDS1_3, Trust_S1 = TRUSTS1, 
                              Risk_S2 = SLIDS2_1, Performance_S2 = SLIDS2_2, 
                              Integrity_S2 = SLIDS2_3, Trust_S2 = TRUSTS2,
                              Risk_S3 = SLIDS3_1, Performance_S3 = SLIDS3_2, 
                              Integrity_S3 = SLIDS3_3, Trust_S3 = TRUSTS3)

#Qualtrics_DF is the base dataframe in the Qualtrics format. You may prefer this format.


Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%    #renaming the values of the scenario conditions for readability
      mutate_at("S1_Condition", str_replace, "S1", "")
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
      mutate_at("S2_Condition", str_replace, "S2", "")
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
      mutate_at("S3_Condition", str_replace, "S3", "")
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
      mutate_at("S3_Condition", str_replace, "S4", "")

#Recoding the trust score likert scale output as a numeric 1-7 variable 

cols1 <- c("Trust_S1", "Trust_S2", "Trust_S3")

values1 <- c("Strongly disagree", "Somewhat disagree", "Disagree", 
            "Neither agree nor disagree", "Somewhat agree", "Agree", "Strongly agree")

numeric_values <- as.character(1:7)

for (col1 in cols1) {
  for (i in seq_along(values1)) {
    Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
      mutate_at(col1, str_replace, values1[i], numeric_values[i])
  }
}

#Change everything required to numeric variables (default import is set to character)

Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Risk_S1 = as.numeric(Risk_S1))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Risk_S2 = as.numeric(Risk_S2))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Risk_S3 = as.numeric(Risk_S3))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Performance_S1 = as.numeric(Performance_S1))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Performance_S2 = as.numeric(Performance_S2))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Performance_S3 = as.numeric(Performance_S3))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Integrity_S1 = as.numeric(Integrity_S1))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Integrity_S2 = as.numeric(Integrity_S2))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Integrity_S3 = as.numeric(Integrity_S3))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Age = as.numeric(Age))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Trust_S1 = as.numeric(Trust_S1))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Trust_S2 = as.numeric(Trust_S2))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Trust_S3 = as.numeric(Trust_S3))

#Change everything relevant to factor variables 

Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Gender = as.factor(Gender))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(Education = as.factor(Education))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(S1_Condition = as.factor(S1_Condition))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(S2_Condition = as.factor(S2_Condition))
Qualtrics_DF <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  mutate(S3_Condition = as.factor(S3_Condition))


```

### Group Count

<br>

#### **Group Count**

```{r Group Count, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

#Setting custom colours for the tables that will be created
customGreen0 = "#DeF7E9"

customGreen = "#71CA97"

customRed = "#ff7f7f"

#Participant count in each high/low condition by Application

S1_Group_Count <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  group_by(S1_Condition) %>% summarise(n = n()) 
S1_Group_Count <- 
  S1_Group_Count %>% rename(n1 = n)

S2_Group_Count <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  group_by(S2_Condition) %>% summarise(n = n()) 
S2_Group_Count <- 
  S2_Group_Count %>% rename(n2 = n)

S3_Group_Count <- Qualtrics_DF %>%
  group_by(S3_Condition) %>% summarise(n = n())
S3_Group_Count <- 
  S3_Group_Count %>% rename(n3 = n)

Group_count_list <- list("S1_Group_Count", "S2_Group_Count", "S3_Group_Count")
Group_Count <- cbind(S1_Group_Count, S2_Group_Count, S3_Group_Count)

Group_Count <- Group_Count %>%    #renaming the values of the scenario conditions for readability
      rename(Car=S1_Condition, Virtual_Cell_Select=S2_Condition, 
             "DataDoc(Hp LP) - Airline (HI LI)"=S3_Condition)


formattable(Group_Count, align =c("c","c","c", "c", "c", "c"), list(
  `S1_Condition` = formatter("span", style = ~ style(color = "grey",font.weight = "bold")), 
  `S2_Condition` = formatter("span", style = ~ style(color = "grey",font.weight = "bold")), 
  `S3_Condition` = formatter("span", style = ~ style(color = "grey",font.weight = "bold")), 
  `S1_n` = color_bar("customGreen0"),
  `S2_n` = color_bar("customGreen0"),
  `S3_n` = color_bar("customGreen0")),
     table.attr = 'class=\"table table-striped\" style="font-size: 18px"')
    

```

```{r Summary Statistics, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# General Summary statistics table for risk, trust, performance and Integrity 

risk_S1_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>% 
  summarise(Mean = round(mean(Risk_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            SD = round(sd(Risk_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            Min = round(min(Risk_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Max = round(max(Risk_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Median = round(median(Risk_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2) 
            ) 

risk_S2_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>% 
  summarise(Mean = round(mean(Risk_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            SD = round(sd(Risk_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            Min = round(min(Risk_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Max = round(max(Risk_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Median = round(median(Risk_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2) 
            ) 

risk_S3_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>% 
  summarise(Mean = round(mean(Risk_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            SD = round(sd(Risk_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            Min = round(min(Risk_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Max = round(max(Risk_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Median = round(median(Risk_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2) 
            ) 

Risk_List <- list(risk_S1_summary, risk_S2_summary, risk_S3_summary)
Risk_Summary <- Risk_List %>% reduce(full_join, by=NULL)
Risk_Summary$AI_Application <- 1:3
Risk_Summary$Score <- rep("Risk", times = 3)
Risk_Order <- c("Score", "AI_Application", "Mean", "SD",
               "Median", "Min", "Max")
Risk_Summary <- Risk_Summary[, Risk_Order]

trust_S1_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>%

Trust_Summary$Score <- rep("Trust", times = 3)

performance_S1_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>%

            SD = round(sd(Performance_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2),

Performance_List <- list(performance_S1_summary, performance_S2_summary, performance_S3_summary)

            Median = round(median(Integrity_S1, na.rm = TRUE),2) 
            ) 

integrity_S2_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>% 
  summarise(Mean = round(mean(Integrity_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            SD = round(sd(Integrity_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            Min = round(min(Integrity_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Max = round(max(Integrity_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Median = round(median(Integrity_S2, na.rm = TRUE),2) 
            ) 

integrity_S3_summary <- Qualtrics_DF %>% 
  summarise(Mean = round(mean(Integrity_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            SD = round(sd(Integrity_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2),
            Min = round(min(Integrity_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Max = round(max(Integrity_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2), 
            Median = round(median(Integrity_S3, na.rm = TRUE),2) 
            ) 

Integrity_List <- list(integrity_S1_summary, integrity_S2_summary, integrity_S3_summary)
Integrity_Summary <- Integrity_List %>% reduce(full_join, by=NULL)
Integrity_Summary$AI_Application <- 1:3
Integrity_Summary$Score <- rep("Integrity", times = 3)
Integrity_Order <- c("Score", "AI_Application", "Mean", "SD",
               "Median", "Min", "Max")
Integrity_Summary <- Integrity_Summary[, Integrity_Order]


Summary_List <- list(Risk_Summary, Trust_Summary, Performance_Summary, Integrity_Summary)
Summary <- Summary_List %>% reduce(full_join, by=NULL)

Summary <- Summary %>%    #renaming the values of the scenario conditions for readability
      mutate_at("AI_Application", str_replace, "1", "Car")
Summary <- Summary %>%    
      mutate_at("AI_Application", str_replace, "2", "Virtual Cell Select")
Summary <- Summary %>%    
      mutate_at("AI_Application", str_replace, "3", "DataDoc / Airline")

formattable(Summary, align =c("l","c","c", "c", "c", "c", "r"), list(
  `Score` = formatter("span", style = ~ style(color = "whitesmoke",font.weight = "normal")), 
            `Mean` = color_bar("orange")),
   table.attr = 'class=\"table table-striped\" style="font-size: 18px"')
```

```{r Violin Box Visualisation1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, results='hide'}
#Scenario 1 Risk

Risk_S1_Violin_Box <- ggplot(data = Qualtrics_DF,  
                   mapping = aes(x = S1_Condition, 
                                 y = Risk_S1, 
                                 fill = S1_Condition) 
                   ) +
  geom_violin(na.rm = TRUE) + 
  geom_boxplot(width=0.2, 
               size=0.2, 
               na.rm = TRUE) +
  stat_summary(fun = "mean",
               geom = "crossbar", 
               width = 0.5,
```

## Exploratory Analysis {.tabset}

**Exploratory Analysis**
<br>

### Regression Models
```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Models
model1=lm(Trust_S1~1,Qualtrics_DF)
model2=lm(Trust_S1~Performance_S1,Qualtrics_DF)
model3=lm(Trust_S1~Performance_S1 + Integrity_S1,Qualtrics_DF)
model4=lm(Trust_S1~Performance_S1 + Integrity_S1 + Risk_S1,Qualtrics_DF)

summary(model2)
standardCoefs(model2)
summary(model3)
standardCoefs(model3)
summary(model4)
standardCoefs(model4)
```

### Regression Comparison

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Model Comparison
tab_model(model1, model2, model3, model4, 
title = "Regression Model Comparison", 
show.aic = TRUE,  
col.order = c("p") )

####ANOVA to calculate the sum of squares. 
####If each model is statistically significant 
#it means adding the variable 
#led to some improvement.

tab_df(anova(model1,model2,model3,model4), title = "ANOVA between models <br> 
<i>Significance interpreted as improvement
 in model due to addition of variable<i>")
```

### Correlations - Collapsed conditions

```{r block, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}


cor.test(Qualtrics_DF$Performance_S1, Qualtrics_DF$Integrity_S1)

cor.test(Qualtrics_DF$Performance_S2, Qualtrics_DF$Integrity_S2)

cor.test(Qualtrics_DF$Performance_S3, Qualtrics_DF$Integrity_S3)



```

### Correlations - Between Condition Type (P or I) for each AI Application

<br><br><br> **Performance Conditions - Correlations between performance and integrity scores for each Application** <br><br><br>

```{r block 2, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}


S1_Performance_Conditions_list <- list(S1_HP, S1_LP)
S1_Performance_Conditions <- S1_Performance_Conditions_list %>% reduce(full_join, by=NULL)
S2_Performance_Conditions_list <- list(S2_HP, S2_LP)
S2_Performance_Conditions <- S2_Performance_Conditions_list %>% reduce(full_join, by=NULL)
S3_Performance_Conditions_list <- list(S3_HP, S3_LP)

cor.test(S1_Performance_Conditions$Performance_S1, S1_Performance_Conditions$Integrity_S1)
cor.test(S2_Performance_Conditions$Performance_S2, S2_Performance_Conditions$Integrity_S2)
cor.test(S3_Performance_Conditions$Performance_S3, S3_Performance_Conditions$Integrity_S3)


```

